TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SaveChangesOptions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates change options when is called.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the ContinueOnError option is set, subsequent operations are still tried even after an error occurs.
When batching is not used, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceResponse.BatchHeaders%2A> property on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceResponse.BatchHeaders%2A> instance returns an empty collection and the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceResponse.BatchStatusCode%2A> property is zero.
You cannot set both Batch and ContinueOnError at the same time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Services.Client.SaveChangesOptions Batch = int32(1)

Docs.summary: All pending changes are saved in a single batch request.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Services.Client.SaveChangesOptions ContinueOnError = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Pending changes are saved by using multiple requests to the server, and the operation continues after an error occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Services.Client.SaveChangesOptions None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Pending changes are saved by using multiple requests to the server, but the operation stops on the first failure (default).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Services.Client.SaveChangesOptions ReplaceOnUpdate = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Pending updates are made by replacing all values of the entity in the data source with values from the updated entity (HTTP PUT) instead of just updating changed values (HTTP MERGE), which is the default behavior.
